page.title: 07St Peter & St Paul's Church
page.content: The original church was opposite the Manor House, where the old churchyard is now. There was a shrine to St. {Rumbold }and an altar to St Catherine, patron saint of lacemakers.The present Church was built in 1780 on Church Hill after the spire of the old Church had fallen down twice. In 1865 the chancel and porch were added. Some interesting things to see in the church are: A{stall}from the old church. An old Latin School{desk}made in 1626. A brass{chandelier}given by Browne Willis M.P. in 1705. Latin{Bible}given by Archdeacon John Rudying in 1471. A copy of the{transfiguration}by {Raphael.}This is being renovated and will be hung at the West End up in the gallery.
